Our Team | Lemonjuice Solutions Skip to content Toggle Navigation HOME SERVICES Strategic Management Future Planning Revenue Optimization Technology Resorts Reimagined Disaster Recovery ABOUT US Our Team The Lemonjuice Story NEWS CAREERS CONTACT OWNERS Our Team 2025-08-07T13:59:52+00:00 The Lemonjuice Team Our team members are industry experts with many years of professional experience to guide Boards and decision makers through crucial choices. Lemonjuice‚Äôs executive leadership includes industry veterans who have worked in the resort and timeshare industry, or commercial real estate, for 25+ years. Our key staff ‚Äì who oversee resort management, customer service, legal research, and other essential functions ‚Äì give us the breadth and depth to strategically manage and deliver the best solutions for resorts. Alex Krakovsky Founder & CEO About Alex Alex is the Founder and CEO of Lemonjuice Capital and Solutions, which was established to help timeshare owners and associations realize the true value and best governance of their properties. He is a seasoned business leader and entrepreneur. Alex is experienced in commercial real estate and mortgage management, venture capital, mergers and acquisitions, government-sponsored investment funds, and the energy sector. He co-founded a power company that operates power plants around the world and grew from five to over 1,400 employees. Scott MacGregor Executive Vice President & COO About Scott Scott has 40 years of executive experience in project planning, development, marketing, and finance. As Executive VP and COO of Lemonjuice Solutions, he oversees corporate and resort operations and develops strategic management plans to enhance long-term resort sustainability. An active member of the American Resort Development Association (ARDA), Scott has held leadership roles, including co-chairing the Legislative and Regulatory Oversight Committee and chairing ARDA‚Äôs International Timeshare Foundation Thinktank series. He is a strong advocate for consumer rights and industry legislation. Jan Barrow Senior VP of Business Development About Jan Jan has 30 years of experience in the vacation ownership and resort timeshare industry. At Interval International, she held leadership roles focused on driving growth and revenue, working closely with developers on all aspects of the development process, from design to operations. A skilled communicator and consensus builder, Jan has been active in ARDA for 30 years and TBMA since 2010, supporting consumer protections, board education, and legislative advocacy. Richard Cunningham Senior VP of Operations About Richard Richard is a partner, broker, and manager at Cunningham Property Management Corp. A Miami University graduate with honors, he launched his career in vacation ownership and now oversees eight resorts along Florida‚Äôs Gulf Coast. With hands-on experience in resort operations and a CAM license, Richard ensures his resorts consistently earn top industry awards. He also serves on the local Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors. Jeff Ingram Senior VP of Real Estate Redevelopment About Jeff Jeff has nearly 40 years of experience in the hospitality and leisure industry, His background includes all aspects of timeshare and whole-ownership property management. Jeff He has held leadership roles at major organizations where he served over 300,000 timeshare owners. Jeff also held executive roles at Vacation Innovations before joining the American Resort Coalition. An active industry participant, Jeff is a longtime ARDA member. He is also a board member of SKAL Orlando, an international association of travel industry executives. Keith Organ Senior VP of Accounting and Treasury About Keith Keith is an accounting and finance leader with expertise in driving the growth and optimization of businesses across technology, SaaS, construction, and hospitality. He has held senior roles at Marriott International, focusing on mergers, acquisitions, and due diligence, and at Travel and Leisure, overseeing corporate accounting. Keith manages financial strategy, treasury, tax, audits, and reporting in compliance with GAAP. He also oversees corporate and association accounting operations. Richard Winkler General Counsel About Richard Richard is a results-oriented businessman and licensed attorney in Rhode Island and Massachusetts. With more than 40 years of experience in acquiring, developing, marketing, selling, and operating complex real properties and companies, he oversees Lemonjuice‚Äôs legal department. Richard‚Äôs experience includes strategy, risk mitigation, dispute resolution, and legal consulting and compliance services. Elizabeth D'Ambro VP of Human Resources About Elizabeth Elizabeth is the Vice President of Human Resources for Lemonjuice Solutions, developing impactful business solutions aligned with HR strategies. Known for adaptability and a people-first approach, she excels in decision-making, team development, time management, and upholding high performance standards. Miisha Brown Senior Executive Assistant About Miisha Miisha joined Lemonjuice Solutions in 2022 as Executive Assistant to the Executive Leadership Team, helping them achieve their organizational goals. Since coming on board, she has streamlined the administrative processes, enabling executives to focus on the high-level priorities. Prior to Lemonjuice, she had 19 years of property management experience in New England and New York before moving to Florida where she managed HOA‚Äôs and still holds a Florida CAM license. Outside of Lemonjuice, she enjoys travel, writing, water activities, and spending quality time with family and friends. Mike Elliot VP of Facilities & Risk Management About Mike Mike supports Lemonjuice‚Äôs resort maintenance teams, ensuring adherence to operating standards and the upkeep of buildings, equipment, and amenities. He works with project and resort managers to meet operational and renovation goals. Before Lemonjuice, Mike served as Wicomico County‚Äôs Deputy Director of Administration and Facilities Director, following a career in law enforcement with the Wicomico County Sheriff‚Äôs Office. Aubrey Vaczi VP of Operations About Aubrey Aubrey Vaczi, Vice President of Operations, brings extensive experience in business management and coastal resort operations. A Florida native, she has held roles as resort manager, regional manager, and director of operations, gaining expertise in property management, business development, and rental marketing. Known for her commitment to integrity and innovation, Aubrey excels at adapting to market trends and fostering a collaborative work environment. Jarvis Phillips Director of Owner Support About Jarvis Jarvis Phillips, Director of Owner Support at Lemonjuice Capital Solutions since September 2022, brings over 25 years of call center experience. He excels in recruiting, training, and managing teams, as well as improving call performance and quality assurance. Jarvis‚Äôs career spans roles in customer service, compliance, and training at major organizations. Outside of work, he enjoys baking, singing, and spending time with his wife and two daughters. Amy Dobson Creative Services Manager About Amy Amy joined the Lemonjuice Business Development Department in 2023 as Creative Services Manager. With a background in photography and marketing, she manages web and graphic design projects, marketing strategy, digital and print marketing campaigns, and social media for multiple departments. In her free time she enjoys pilates, playing the piano, and spending time with friends and family. Lee Rushin Business Development Account Executive About Lee Lee has nearly 35 years experience in the vacation ownership and resort timeshare industry. At RCI, he held leadership roles focused on driving customer fulfillment and retention satisfaction. As a skilled communicator and longtime member of ARDA, Lee has supported developers as well as HOA‚Äôs on all aspects of their business ‚Äì from sales to operations to providing quality improvement direction and training. Lee is also a member of ARDA-ROC/TBMA and holds a Florida Real Estate license. Amy Rhodes Rental Inventory Manager About Amy With 20 years of experience in the timeshare industry and a degree in Travel & Hospitality Management, Amy is a seasoned leader and subject matter expert. She joined Lemonjuice in 2024 after nearly two decades in exchange operations, bringing a passion for team building, data-driven decision-making, and process improvement. Known for her clear, consistent communication and talent for building strong relationships across teams and stakeholders, she thrives on driving meaningful change. Outside of work, she enjoys exploring new destinations, learning about different cultures, and advocating for the autistic community. Kris Johnson Project Manager About Kris Kris is a Project Manager at Lemonjuice, known for crafting strategic, innovative plans that deliver exceptional results for diverse stakeholders. A Georgia State University graduate with a Business Administration degree, Kris has over 15 years of experience in technology, marketing, and real estate. He is also a certified Project Management Professional (PMP). Outside of work, Kris enjoys basketball, golf, traveling, and time with family and friends. Brian Miller Project Manager About Brian Brian is a Project Manager for Lemonjuice Capital Solutions. He holds a degree in Project Management from Cornell University and is both a South Carolina Notary and a licensed South Carolina Property Manager. With over 15 years of experience in the hospitality industry, Brian has focused primarily on resort operations in the Myrtle Beach market. Lina Rocha-Perez Project Manager About Lina Lina is a bilingual Project Manager with 17+ years of experience in real estate, legal services, and operations. At Lemonjuice Capital Solutions, she leads multimillion-dollar property transformations and resolves complex title issues. Lina‚Äôs skills span project planning, legal documentation, and AI-driven process improvements. She‚Äôs an active member of the Project Management Institute and mentors future leaders. Thomas Wood Technical Implementation Manager About Thomas Thomas joined Lemonjuice in 2022 as our Technical Implementation Manager and oversees Technical Operations. After serving 5 years in the US Army, he earned an MBA from Rollins College in 2020 and a Master‚Äôs in Data Analytics from Nova Southeastern University the following year. He is also a certified Black Belt in Lean Six Sigma and is very passionate about process improvement and the role of new technologies that drive efficiency. Experience the Difference with Lemonjuice Solutions. 7380 W. insurance Recommended Videos Local News Jags owner Shad Khan planning redevelopment of Seahorse Oceanfront Inn and Lemon Bar in Neptune Beach, documents state Tarik Minor , Anchor, I-TEAM reporter Published: May 12, 2025 at 4:00 PM Updated: May 12, 2025 at 7:28 PM Tags: Neptune Beach , Duval County , Seahorse Oceanfront Inn , Lemon Bar , Shad Khan NEPTUNE BEACH, Fla. ‚Äì Jaguars owner Shad Khan‚Äôs development company, Iguana Investments Florida LLC, acquired the Seahorse Oceanfront Inn and Lemon Bar in Neptune Beach in August 2023 for $36.95 million, marking Khan‚Äôs first project outside downtown Jacksonville. Now, documents obtained by News4JAX indicate that plans for the properties may include a private beach club, spa, fitness center, restaurant, improved Lemon Bar, parking, and retail space, transforming the area into a boutique resort hotel. Lemon Bar and Grille in Neptune Beach (lemonbarjax.com) And residents have expressed mixed reactions to the proposed redevelopment. Jake Mitchum, a Neptune Beach local, voiced concerns about potential overcrowding and the loss of the community‚Äôs local charm. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got enough traffic already coming through here... I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs anything we are worried about from the moment,‚Äù Mitchum said. Conversely, some residents welcome the changes. Pashent Robinson believes the development will bring excitement and attract younger visitors to the area. ‚ÄúI think Neptune Beach is definitely ready for that... this will bring new fresher faces,‚Äù Robinson stated. At this time, no final redevelopment plans have been submitted to the city of Neptune Beach. Iguana Investments has stated that business will continue at both the Seahorse Oceanfront Inn and the Lemon Bar under the management of Remington Hospitality, a national hotel management company. As the community awaits further developments, Iguana Investments sent News4JAX the following statement: Iguana Investments is currently operating the Seahorse Oceanfront Inn and Lemon Bar as is, with investments in capital improvements underway in the hotel rooms and the bar for our guests and patrons. There are no immediate plans for changes to the property. Once there are plans for the site, we will make a formal announcement and go through proper protocol with the city of Neptune Beach. Spokesperson for Iguana Investments Copyright 2025 by WJXT News4JAX - All rights reserved. For the past four years, we‚Äôve been proving that you don‚Äôt need to be rich, retired, or remote workers to see the world. We work hard in the U.S., live frugally at home, and then take off for months at a time‚Äîexploring new countries, diving into local food and drink scenes, and sharing it all with our audience. We create content for people who want to travel better‚Äînot just cheaper. Through our YouTube channel, Instagram, and blog, we share practical tips, honest recommendations, and behind-the-scenes stories from over 30 countries (and counting). We want you to skip the guesswork, eat the BEST food, and experience the kind of travel that stays with you long after you‚Äôve unpacked. Our love for travel goes far beyond sightseeing. For us, it‚Äôs about immersing ourselves in the culture ‚Äîwandering neighborhood markets, trying the dishes locals grew up eating, tasting regional spirits, and sipping coffee in corner caf√©s. We believe these moments are where the real magic of travel happens. Whether you‚Äôre here for destination guides, travel planning tips, packing hacks, or just a bit of inspiration for your next trip, we‚Äôre glad you found us. Stick around‚Äîwe‚Äôve got a lot more of the world to explore together. Come with us! Explore our adventures with us! About Us | The Hairy Lemon About Us Menus Breakfast Menu Bar Menu Reserve Areas Merch Contact About Us Menus Breakfast Menu Bar Menu Reserve Areas Merch Contact The Hairy Lemon One of Dublin‚Äôs Trendiest Pubs! The Hairy Lemon is just about as unconventional as it‚Äôs a namesake. The 19th-century house in which it resides is a little ‚Äòoutside-the-box‚Äô as well. Painted with years of memorabilia, with a sitting room suspended in mid-air. With High Nellie‚Äôs, Wellies and even Granny‚Äôs Kitchen. The blockbuster film, ‚ÄúThe Commitments‚Äù also lives on in the Hairy Lemon Pub. Many scenes were filmed using the snug and bar counter from the pub. With that said, just a few of the reasons why ‚ÄúThe Hairy Lemon‚Äù has become one of Dublin‚Äôs best known pubs. Lovingly painted with years of memorabilia, suspended in mid-air. Private Event Hire Book A Table Try some Irish Whiskey Why not ask the bar staff about your favourite whiskey or maybe try something new? We have a great selection of Irish whiskies, there is definitely something you‚Äôll enjoy! Watch your favourite sport Looking for somewhere to watch your favourite sport? Look no further. We show all major sporting events, from Irish GAA, Premier League, Golf or Rugby‚Ä¶ (we‚Äôre big Rugby fans!) Listen and enjoy live music With a mix of traditional Irish music and live bands played throughout the week, you‚Äôll be spoilt for choice. Grab a pint of the good stuff, pull up a chair and sit back and enjoy the atmosphere. One of Dublin‚Äôs greatest characters This ‚Äúmysterious‚Äù Pub was christened in memory of one of Dublin‚Äôs great characters who most likely got his name from his odd appearance! His face was lemon-shaped with the complexion of his skin akin to that particular fruit, and stubble resembling that which grows on a gooseberry. ‚ÄúHairy‚Äù was to be seen roaming the streets of Dublin in the 1940s, catching stray dogs for the police! Opening Hours Mon-Thurs: 10am ‚Äì 11:30pm Fri-Sat: 10am ‚Äì 12:30am Sun: 10am ‚Äì 11pm Visit Us 41-42 Stephen Street Lower, Dublin 2 T: (01)6718949 E: info@thehairylemon.ie Website Design by EscalateWebDesign.ie Reservations At present, we are only accepting booking enquiries for groups of 10 or more. For less then 10 people, we are accommodating walk-ins only. If you would like to make a booking for 10 or more people, please send us an email with details of your party, number of people, date and time to: bookings@thehairylemon.ie

+ Child (0-6 years): - + + Add Another Room Apply Book Now About Us Our Story Our Brands Awards Vision, Mission, Values CSR Eco-Friendly Practices Safety And Security Management Pooch Policy In the early 2000s, 80% of the branded hotel supply in India
                  was in the upscale/luxury segment. There was clearly enormous
                  latent demand in the midscale and economy segments, which were
                  then unmet needs. Lemon Tree Hotels was founded as the
                  category creator for the branded mid-market hotel space in
                  India. Today, Lemon Tree Hotels Limited (LTHL) is one of the largest
                  hotel chains in India, and owns/leases/operates/franchises
                  hotels across the upscale, upper-midscale, midscale and
                  economy segments. LTHL delivers differentiated yet superior
                  service offerings, with a compelling value proposition. The
                  group offers seven brands to meet guests‚Äô needs across all
                  levels, viz. Aurika Hotels & Resorts, Lemon Tree Premier,
                  Lemon Tree Hotels, Red Fox Hotels by Lemon Tree Hotels, Keys
                  Prima by Lemon Tree Hotels, Keys Select by Lemon Tree Hotels
                  and Keys Lite by Lemon Tree Hotels. LTHL opened its first hotel with 49 rooms in May 2004. Today,
                  the company has a portfolio of 160+ hotels, which includes
                  over 100+ operational hotels and more than 60 hotels set to
                  open in India and internationally. Lemon Tree Hotels are
                  located across metro regions, including the NCR, Mumbai,
                  Kolkata, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Chennai, as well as numerous
                  tier I, II and III cities such as Pune, Ahmedabad, Chandigarh,
                  Jaipur, Indore, Aurangabad, Udaipur, Vishakhapatnam, Kochi,
                  Ludhiana, Thiruvananthapuram, Vijayawada etc. The company
                  expanded internationally with hotels opening in Dubai in
                  December 2019 and in Bhutan in February 2020. New hotels are
                  also set to open internationally in Bhutan and Nepal. The group offers seven brands to meet guests‚Äô needs across all
                  levels: Aurika Hotels and Resorts Upscale Lemon Tree Premier Upper

                  Indian chain of upscale, upper-midscale, midscale and economy
                  hotels and resorts. Mission We shall be committed to: Ensuring the well-being and self-worth of our colleagues,
                    who are of the utmost importance to us. Enhancing this by
                    also building a culture of diversity, inclusion and equal
                    opportunity. Contributing to the community we live in and to India in

                    be the most cost-effective company offering the greatest
                    value, which our customers have every right to expect Core Values (Has To Rise): H ealth A nd S afety: We will
                  always focus on ensuring the health, safety, security and
                  well-being of all our stake holders including the communities
                  within which we operate our business. T eamwork ‚Äì We recognize that superlative
                    performance is always the result of teamwork. O wnership ‚Äì We always take responsibility
                    for our actions. R espect and Empathy ‚Äì We always exhibit
                    respect and concern for colleagues, guests and partners. I ntegrity ‚Äì We always maintain the
                    highest standards of fairness and transparency in all our
                    dealings. S pirited Fun ‚Äì We create an exciting and
                    spirited work environment encouraging our colleagues to
                    think freely. E xcellence ‚Äì We always drive excellence
                    in what we do. Learning And Development The company has implemented a detailed plan for learning and
                  development in order to deliver on its brand promise and has
                  developed customized content and training processes for LTH
                  that are world class as well as benchmarked across industries. Corporate Social Responsibility Lemon Tree believes that the brand should stand for more than
                  ‚Äòjust profit‚Äô. We have focused our efforts on creating a
                  socially inclusive work environment which seeks to bring in
                  people of different backgrounds, abilities and ethnicities and
                  offer them work as a unified team with a common goal. We believe that persons with disabilities (which can be
                  physical, social or economic disabilities leading to an
                  opportunity deprivation) must be provided the same
                  opportunities as others to realize their full potential and
                  live with dignity. By creating a supportive environment in the
                  organization that allows them to deliver their best, we are
                  able to play a part, however small, in social inclusiveness,
                  opportunity/livelihood creation and therefore nation building. Lemon Tree has defined the goal as mainstreaming ‚ÄòOpportunity
                  Deprived Indians‚Äô i.e. ODIs into its workforce. ODIs include: A. Employees With Disability (EwD): Physical Disability Speech and Hearing Impaired (SHI) Orthopedically Handicapped (OH) Acid Survivors (AS) Going forward, also Visually Impaired (VI), Low Vision (LV) Intellectual Disability Down Syndrome Autism People who belong to marginalized sections of society or are
                  from the Economically/ Socially (EcoSoc) weak segment: Below Poverty Line (BPL) individuals Widowed or abandoned/battered/destitute/divorced women Orphans/abandoned girls Individuals from economically weak families Communities who do not get education and employment
                    opportunities easily i.e. North Eastern States, Bihar,
                    Jharkand, Chhattisgarh, Orissa, tribal/interior areas of any
                    state, etc. For any of the above segments (except #2), we consider those
                  who have studied upto Class 9 and not beyond that. Evolution of the EWD Initiative | Disability Types In the early stages, we inducted EwD only in back-end roles
                  like Kitchen Stewarding and Housekeeping, where direct guest
                  interaction was minimal. Also the focus was only on SHI
                  employees. This gave us an opportunity to develop standard
                  operating procedures and training modules in an iterative
                  manner. Subsequently we extended this initiative to guest
                  contact areas such as our restaurants. Here, interaction with
                  guests is an integral part of the job role. We then
                  re-engineered the relevant service process to enable EwD to
                  interact with guests. We also engaged with people with
                  orthopaedic impairment where their disability did not come in
                  the way of their job performance. We have now done six trials
                  with Down Syndrome in Delhi/NCR at the coffee shop. As we are
                  building sufficient learning and experience from this
                  exercise, we will start hiring such candidates across other
                  hotels in the group and slowly ramp up to a national scale.
                  Autism trials (two) and Acid Survivor trials have started too
                  and the learnings are being assimilated. This initiative was started in 2007. As on May, 2018,
                  approximately 21% of our own employees are Indians who are

                  by PFA for the welfare and care of animals across India. Lemon Tree Hotels - Eco-Friendly Practices Committed to a healthy and happy earth, Lemon Tree Hotels has

                      Clearance Safety and Security: At Lemon Tree Hotels, safety and security of our guests,
                  employees and assets is paramount to us. Our security
                  department has invested in updated technology and equipment
                  for all our recent hotels and evaluates ways to upgrade
                  security measures in our older hotels. For example, our hotel, Lemon Tree Premier, Delhi Airport has
                  adopted face recognition software together with cameras, a
                  video wall in the security control room, a 3D walkthrough and
                  bio-metric access control. Some key security arrangements in
                  our recent hotels include crash bollards and boom barriers at
                  each entrance, under-vehicle surveillance systems, baggage
                  x-ray scanners, CCTV coverage of all public areas, intruder
                  alarm system and panic buttons at key locations such as the
                  main gate, reception and swimming pool areas. Some of the measures in practice are: Baggage scanners to ensure that all guest baggage is
                    screened on arrival CCTVs located in all public areas especially at strategic
                    points Individual fire indicators outside each room to expedite
                    emergency response in case of a fire emergency Wide angle (110 degrees) peephole on room entrance doors Safety chain and double lock facility in the main room door
                    interactions Emergency procedures notice displayed behind the entrance
                    door Fire resistant room door (up to a limited extent) All entrance doors are lined with an environmental seal to
                    minimize noise and protect the room from external smoke, in
                    case of fire Smoke detector in each room Water sprinklers in each room for enhanced fire safety Entrance door and bathroom doors can be double locked from
                    the inside Low level signage on all our buildings A public address system (in most hotels) to help evacuate
                    guests and employees during an emergency 24x7 power backup LTH is run by a group of experienced hotel professionals who
